text: Daniel Gluckstein (born 3 March 1953 in Paris) is a French politician. He was the lead candidate for the Workers' Party in the 1994 European Parliament election; he later received 0.43% of the vote. He ran for president in the 2002 French presidential election. He received 0.47% of the vote, with 132,686 votes. In June 2008, he created the Independent Workers' Party (Parti Ouvrier Indépendant) together with Gérard Schivardi. == References == Category:1953 births Category:Living people Category:Jewish French politicians Category:Politicians from Paris
title: Daniel Gluckstein
